intro: Elatostema platyphyllum var. polycephalum, commonly known as the broad-leaf elatostema, is a herbaceous plant native to eastern Australia. It belongs to the family Urticaceae, which includes nettle and related plants. The plant features small, ovate leaves with a waxy coating and produces tiny greenish-white flowers. It is often found in moist, shaded areas such as forest floors and rocky outcrops. Its botanical characteristics make it an interesting subject for study in ecological and horticultural contexts.
